item.title: 新加坡在经济增长保持稳定的情况下维持政策不变
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全球贸易战带来了风险，但在经济增长强于预期的情况下，新加坡仍维持货币政策不变。【原文：Singapore kept its monetary policy unchanged amid stronger-than-expected economic growth despite the risks from President Donald Trump’ global trade war.】

item.title: 全球经济反弹打开销售窗口，中国计划出口锌矿
item.description: 国际锌价飙升后出现了难得的交易机会，中国锌生产商正准备向海外出售锌金属。【原文：Chinese zinc producers are preparing to sell the metal overseas, as a rare trading opportunity opens up after a spike in international prices.】

item.title: 新西兰央行计划放宽对高风险住房贷款的限制
item.description: 新西兰央行将允许贷款机构从 12 月起发放更多高风险住房贷款，这可能会促进房地产市场的发展。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank will allow lenders to make more higher-risk housing loans from December in a potential boost to the property market.】

item.title: 货币贬值大辩论波及全球市场
item.description: 在金融市场短期起伏的表象之下，随着投资者寻求保护自己免受预算赤字失控的威胁，多种资产的长期重新定价可能正在进行。【原文：Beneath the surface of the short-term ups and downs of financial markets, a longer-term repricing of multiple assets may be underway as investors seek to protect themselves from the threats posed by runaway budget deficits.】

item.title: 13 亿美元首次公开募股后，LG 印度公司首次亮相即被认为有望崛起
item.description: 印度 LG 电子有限公司周二在孟买首次公开发行股票，投资者蜂拥而至，使其成为印度 17 年来同类交易中超额认购最多的十亿美元股票，该公司似乎准备在孟买首次交易中上涨。【原文：LG Electronics India Ltd. appears to be poised to rise in its Mumbai trading debut on Tuesday after investors flocked to its initial public offering, making it the country’s most oversubscribed billion-dollar deal of its kind in 17 years.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Indus 聘请日本负责人加强企业活动
item.description: 美国对冲基金公司 Indus Capital Partners 已聘请一名日本代表领导其东京办事处，这是继外国金融公司在日本首都新聘请多名领导之后的又一举措。【原文：American hedge fund firm Indus Capital Partners has hired a Japan representative to head its Tokyo office, adding to a number of new leadership hires by foreign financial firms in the capital city.】

item.title: 中美贸易关系紧张，需求受关注，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于投资者权衡中美贸易紧张局势重燃对需求的影响，石油在本周开盘时止跌回升。【原文：Oil steadied after paring a slump in the week’s opening session, as investors weigh the fallout of renewed US-China trade tensions against demand.】

item.title: 桑托斯首席财务官杜荷辞职仅一年
item.description: 桑托斯有限公司首席财务官 Sherry Duhe 在任职仅一年后辞职。【原文：Santos Ltd. Chief Financial Officer Sherry Duhe has resigned after just one year in the role.】

item.title: 英国重大网络攻击激增 50%，顶级企业成为攻击目标
item.description: 英国网络安全机构称，去年，犯罪分子和敌对国家发动的重大网络攻击大幅增加，此前，从捷豹路虎到玛莎百货集团等公司接连遭到高调攻击。【原文：The UK has seen a significant increase in major cyberattacks by criminals and hostile states over the last year, the country’s cyber security agency said, following a spate of high-profile incidents targeting companies from Jaguar Land Rover to Marks and Spencer Group Plc.】

item.title: 英国零售商协会（BRC）称，英国零售销售增长因预算担忧而放缓
item.description: 英国 9 月份的零售额增速放缓，原因是温暖的天气推迟了人们购买昂贵外套和靴子的时间，同时购物者也在为政府 11 月份的预算做准备。【原文：UK retail sales grew at a slower pace in September as warm weather delayed purchases of expensive coats and boots and as shoppers braced for the government’s November budget.】

item.title: 印尼财政上限审查得到危机时期政策改革者的支持
item.description: 在亚洲金融危机后帮助印尼重建经济的一位重要技术官僚表示，数十年来一直作为印尼财政政策基础的预算赤字上限现在有可能阻碍经济增长。【原文：One of the key technocrats who helped rebuild Indonesia’s economy after the Asian financial crisis says the budget-deficit cap that has anchored the country’s fiscal policy for decades now risks holding back growth.】

item.title: 亚马逊解雇抗议公司与以色列关系的员工
item.description: 亚马逊公司已经解雇了一名抗议该电子商务巨头与以色列政府关系的员工。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. has terminated an employee who protested the e-commerce giant’s ties to the Israeli government.】

item.title: 三星借全球人工智能热潮实现 2022 年以来最大盈利
item.description: 三星电子公司公布了三年多来最大的季度利润，反映出存储芯片需求的蓬勃发展，同时全球人工智能的发展也在加速。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. posted its biggest quarterly profit in more than three years, reflecting booming memory chip demand while AI development accelerates globally.】

item.title: 新西兰零售支出增长预示经济增长
item.description: 新西兰第三季度的零售卡支出有所恢复，暗示随着利率下降，经济增长可能已经恢复。【原文：New Zealand retail card spending recovered in the third quarter, hinting that economic growth may have returned as interest rates declined.】

item.title: 贸易和日本风险逼近，澳元兑日元汇率面临失守风险
item.description: 由于中美贸易紧张局势再起和日本政治的不确定性对澳元兑日元构成压力，澳元兑日元近期可能难以守住涨幅。【原文：The Australian dollar may struggle to hold gains against the yen in the near term as the resurgence in US-China trade tensions and political uncertainty in Japan weigh on the currency pair.】

item.title: 日本股市走低，其他市场情绪高涨：市场综述
item.description: 日本股市在周末三天后重新开市时似乎将下滑，尽管对中美贸易谈判的乐观情绪再次提振了全球股市。【原文：Japanese stocks look set to slide when markets reopen after a three-day weekend, even as renewed optimism over US-China trade talks lifts sentiment across global equities.】

item.title: 据称 Blackstone 最快将于 2026 年为 Copeland 的 IPO 挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 已为艾默生电气公司前环境优化技术部门的首次公开募股挑选了银行，这距离该业务估值 140 亿美元的交易完成已有两年半时间。【原文：Blackstone Inc. has picked banks for an initial public offering of Emerson Electric Co.’s former Climate Technologies arm, according to people familiar with the matter, two and a half years after the closing of a deal that valued the business at $14 billion.】

item.title: 人工智能图像生成器 Black Forest 正在洽谈 32.5 亿美元估值事宜
item.description: 据熟悉谈判情况的人士透露，Salesforce Ventures 和由 Andreessen Horowitz 普通合伙人 Anjney Midha 掌舵的新投资机构 AMP 将共同领投德国人工智能图像生成器初创公司 Black Forest Labs 的最新一轮融资。【原文：Salesforce Ventures and AMP, a new investment vehicle helmed by Andreessen Horowitz general partner Anjney Midha, are set to co-lead the latest funding round for German AI image generator startup Black Forest Labs, according to people familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 价值 1310 亿美元的加密货币崩盘令交易商担心造成持久损害
item.description: 上周，另类币赌场以投机者的方式炸开了锅— 现在还不清楚赌徒们会不会回来。【原文：The altcoin casino blew up in speculator fashion last week — and it’s not clear the gamblers are coming back.】

item.title: 白银飙升至每盎司 52.50 美元以上的历史新高
item.description: 现货白银价格飙升至每盎司 52.50 美元以上的历史新高，超过了 1980 年试图占领全球市场时创下的峰值。【原文：Spot silver prices surged to an all-time high above $52.50 an ounce, eclipsing a peak set in during a notorious attempt to the corner the global market in 1980.】

item.title: I Squared 即将以 15 亿美元收购 ECP 旗下的自由轮胎公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，桥点集团（Bridgepoint Group Plc）旗下的能源资本合伙公司（Energy Capital Partners）将以 15 亿美元（包括债务）的价格把北美回收平台自由轮胎回收公司（Liberty Tire Recycling）出售给基础设施公司 I Squared Capital。【原文：Energy Capital Partners, part of Bridgepoint Group Plc, is selling North American recycling platform Liberty Tire Recycling to infrastructure firm I Squared Capital for $1.5 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 电池制造商 Fluence 预计 2026 年美国需求将占半壁江山
item.description: Fluence Energy Inc. 预计，随着电气化和数据中心增长带来的电力需求激增，明年美国订单将占其积压订单的很大一部分。【原文：Fluence Energy Inc. expects US orders to make up a large share of its backlog next year as power demand surges from electrification and data center growth.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战的前线？看看肯塔基州
item.description:
肯塔基州州长安迪-贝希尔（Andy Beshear）谈特朗普的贸易战如何打击该州的制造业中心--更不用说波旁酒了。【原文：

Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear on how Trump’s trade war is hitting the state’s manufacturing hubs – not to mention bourbon.

】

item.title: 中国钢铁需求平缓，力拓铁矿石出口保持稳定
item.description: 力拓集团第三季度的铁矿石发货量与上年同期相比保持稳定，尽管中国对钢铁的需求趋于平稳，但这家主要生产商仍投入巨资以维持产量。【原文：Rio Tinto Group’s third-quarter iron ore shipments were steady from the year before, as the major producer invests heavily to maintain output despite plateauing Chinese demand for steel.】

item.title: 英国央行曼恩：英国脱欧和特鲁斯是英镑长期下跌的原因之一
item.description: 英国央行决策者凯瑟琳-曼恩（Catherine Mann）表示，英国脱欧和前首相利兹-特鲁斯（Liz Truss）使英国经济竞争力下降、增长放缓，面临更大的通胀风险。【原文：Brexit and former Prime Minister Liz Truss made the UK a less-competitive, slower-growing economy that faces a greater risk of inflation, Bank of England policymaker Catherine Mann said.】

item.title: Saylor's Strategy 以史上最高价恢复比特币交易
item.description: 由迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）创立的比特币财务公司 Strategy Inc. 自本月早些时候比特币创下历史新高以来首次买入这种数字货币，在数月减少购买量后将其持有量提高到 730 亿美元以上。【原文：Strategy Inc., the Bitcoin treasury company founded by Michael Saylor, bought the digital currency for the first time since it reached a record high earlier this month, raising its holdings to over $73 billion after months of tapering off its purchases.】

item.title: 特朗普在华尔街迅速获胜背后的银行家
item.description:
多米尼克控股公司（Dominari Holdings）的凯尔-伍尔（Kyle Wool）帮助小唐纳德和埃里克炒股赚了5亿多美元。【原文：

Dominari Holdings’ Kyle Wool has helped Donald Jr. and Eric make more than half a billion dollars boosting stocks.

】

item.title: 日本股市将下跌，日本国债在市场重开后面临波动
item.description: 继日本执政联盟垮台和中美贸易紧张局势再次爆发之后，日本市场在为期三天的周末之后将迎来一个动荡的开盘。【原文：Japanese markets are poised for a turbulent open after a three-day weekend following the collapse of the nation’s ruling coalition and another flare-up in US-China trade tensions.】

item.title: 高盛以高达 9.65 亿美元收购风险投资公司 Industry Ventures
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said it agreed to buy venture capital firm Industry Ventures as part of an expansion of the company’s asset-management division.】

item.title: 200 亿美元杠杆效应消失后，比特币的反弹岌岌可危
item.description: 比特币在上周五创纪录的加密货币暴跌后小幅回升，但这丝毫无助于缓解超过 200 亿美元的杠杆押注被清洗所带来的影响，这导致部分市场陷入瘫痪。交易员们说，这场史无前例的清洗抹去了数月来的投机积累，并迫使一些基金完全退出。【原文：Bitcoin’s modest recovery after Friday’s record crypto crash has done little to ease the fallout from over $20 billion purge of leveraged bets that left parts of the market incapacitated. The unprecedented washout erased months of speculative build-up and forced some funds out entirely, traders say.】
